column4: A cohort shall be associated to one Program of Study offered by the department.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort.
Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort's Program of Study.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall specify the quarter in which each class will be offered.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes to a sequence of classes.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall add a new cohort to the system identified by start month and year.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department.
A class shall be either a non-clinical class or a clinical class.
A non-clinical class shall specify the course name, lecture room requirements, and instructor needs.
A clinical class shall specify the course name, room requirements, clinical site needs, lecture and lab instructor needs.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.
A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and a listing of required classes (clinical and non-clinical).
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall specify which classes are required for a Program of Study.
The system shall display a report of needed classes for all cohorts of all programs for planning purposes.
The report shall include needed classes, number of sections, number of labs, and room types.
Classes for a given cohort shall not conflict regarding time and day.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical site into the system.
Clinical site information shall include the name of the site, contact person, and contact information.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall add a clinical lab section for an existing clinical class.
A clinical lab section shall include the clinical site name, class instructor, day, and time of the lab.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall add a student to a clinical lab section.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to remove a student from a clinical lab section.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall move a student from one clinical lab section to another.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall cancel a clinical lab section if no students are registered.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new nursing student to the system.
A staff member shall manage the progress of a part-time student, including modifying their sequence of classes.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to view a summary for individual cohorts, including progress.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to view a summary for clinical sites, including lab details.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to view a summary for clinical labs, including lab details.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to view a summary for nursing students, including ID and cohort.
Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to view a summary of the system log.

column3: Staff Members, Students, Instructors, Clinical Site Administrators
column4: The system shall contain contact information for all relevant people, including staff, students, andÂ instructors.
